results.title: Influences of pravastatin and simvastatin, HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors, on myocardial stunning in dogs.
results.text_hl: Influences of @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors, on @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@myocardial stunning@@@ in @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@.

citations.NLM: Ichihara K, Satoh K, Abiko Y. Influences of pravastatin and simvastatin, HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors, on myocardial stunning in dogs. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1993 Dec;22(6):852-6. PMID: 7509904

results.title: The effects of simvastatin on angiogenesis: studied by an original model of atherosclerosis and acute myocardial infarction in rabbit.
results.text_hl: We demonstrated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has the effect of pro-angiogenesis and further improve cardiac function in @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@ischemic myocardium@@@, as well as the effect of anti-angiogenesis to improve @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@ in aorta vessels.

citations.NLM: Shen W, Shi HM, Fan WH, Luo XP, Jin B, Li Y. The effects of simvastatin on angiogenesis: studied by an original model of atherosclerosis and acute myocardial infarction in rabbit. Mol Biol Rep. 2011 Aug;38(6):3821-8. PMID: 21107720
citations.BibTeX: @article{21107720, title={The effects of simvastatin on angiogenesis: studied by an original model of atherosclerosis and acute myocardial infarction in rabbit.}, author={Shen W and Shi HM and Fan WH and Luo XP and Jin B and Li Y}, journal={Mol Biol Rep}, volume={38}, number={6}, pages={3821-8}}

results.title: Lipophilic HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors increase myocardial stunning in dogs.
results.text_hl: Pretreatment of @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, a lipophilic @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_479182 @@@3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase@@@ inhibitor, increases @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@myocardial contractile dysfunction@@@ during reperfusion after @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@stunning@@@), with reduction of tissue @CHEMICAL_Adenosine_Triphosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000255 @@@adenosine triphosphate@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Adenosine_Triphosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000255 @@@ATP@@@).

citations.NLM: Satoh K, Ichihara K. Lipophilic HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors increase myocardial stunning in dogs. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 2000 Feb;35(2):256-62. PMID: 10672858
citations.BibTeX: @article{10672858, title={Lipophilic HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors increase myocardial stunning in dogs.}, author={Satoh K and Ichihara K}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={35}, number={2}, pages={256-62}}

results.title: Protective effect of simvastatin and VULM 1457 in ischaemic-reperfused myocardium of the diabetic-hypercholesterolemic rats.
results.text_hl: Protective effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_VULM_1457 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C505646 @@@VULM 1457@@@ in @DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@-reperfused @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@myocardium@@@ of the @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@-@DISEASE_Hyperlipoproteinemia_Type_II @DISEASE_MESH:D006938 @@@hypercholesterolemic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Adameová A, Kuzelová M, Faberová V, Svec P. Protective effect of simvastatin and VULM 1457 in ischaemic-reperfused myocardium of the diabetic-hypercholesterolemic rats. Pharmazie. 2006 Sep;61(9):807-8. PMID: 17020164

results.title: Simvastatin preserves the ischemic-reperfused myocardium in normocholesterolemic rat hearts.
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ significantly reduced PMN accumulation in the @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@ischemic myocardium@@@ (P<0.01).

citations.NLM: Lefer AM, Campbell B, Shin YK, Scalia R, Hayward R, Lefer DJ. Simvastatin preserves the ischemic-reperfused myocardium in normocholesterolemic rat hearts. Circulation. 1999 Jul 13;100(2):178-84. PMID: 10402448

results.title: Effects of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A reductase inhibitors on mitochondrial respiration in ischaemic dog hearts.
results.text_hl: Significant differences in RCI between nonischaemic and @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@ischaemic myocardium@@@ were observed in the control and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated groups. 5.

results.title: Efficacy and Mechanism of Preoperative Simvastatin Therapy on Myocardial Protection after Extracorporeal Circulation
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ reduced the generation of autophagosomes and the ultrastructural injuries to @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@myocardium@@@.

citations.NLM: Hua P, Liu J, Tao J, Zou R, Lin X, Zhang D, Yang S. Efficacy and Mechanism of Preoperative Simvastatin Therapy on Myocardial Protection after Extracorporeal Circulation Biomed Res Int. 2017;2017():6082430. PMID: 29250545

results.title: HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors inhibit endothelial exocytosis and decrease myocardial infarct size.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ decreased endothelial exocytosis and neutrophil infiltration into @DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@-reperfused @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@myocardium@@@, which was mediated in part by @GENE_SELP @GENE_20344 @@@P-selectin@@@ contained in Weibel-Palade bodies.

citations.NLM: Yamakuchi M, Greer JJ, Cameron SJ, Matsushita K, Morrell CN, Talbot-Fox K, Baldwin WM 3rd, Lefer DJ, Lowenstein CJ. HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors inhibit endothelial exocytosis and decrease myocardial infarct size. Circ Res. 2005 Jun 10;96(11):1185-92. PMID: 15905463

results.title: Pretreatment with simvastatin reduces myocardial no-reflow by opening mitochondrial K(ATP) channel.
results.text_hl: However, the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment on the restoration of blood flow to @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@ischemic myocardium@@@ are not known.

citations.NLM: Zhao JL, Yang YJ, Cui CJ, You SJ, Gao RL. Pretreatment with simvastatin reduces myocardial no-reflow by opening mitochondrial K(ATP) channel. Br J Pharmacol. 2006 Oct;149(3):243-9. PMID: 16921391

results.title: HMG-CoA reductase inhibition prior reperfusion improves reparative fibrosis post-myocardial infarction in a preclinical experimental model.
results.text_hl: This treatment regime attenuated reperfusion-related @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@arrhythmias@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@stunning@@@ leading to a 40% increased myocardial salvage (p<0.05 vs. vehicle/control). 3 weeks post-MI @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated animals showed P-PKCepsilon increase, lower intramyocardial lipotoxicity, TbetaRII/@GENE_SMAD2 @GENE_100155304;397260 @@@Smad2/3@@@ signaling restoration and subsequent myofibroblast differentiation and collagen-fibril formation in the evolving scar (p<0.05 vs. control).

citations.NLM: Vilahur G, Casani L, Peña E, Juan-Babot O, Mendieta G, Crespo J, Badimon L. HMG-CoA reductase inhibition prior reperfusion improves reparative fibrosis post-myocardial infarction in a preclinical experimental model. Int J Cardiol. 2014 Aug 20;175(3):528-38. PMID: 25023790
citations.BibTeX: @article{25023790, title={HMG-CoA reductase inhibition prior reperfusion improves reparative fibrosis post-myocardial infarction in a preclinical experimental model.}, author={Vilahur G and Casani L and Peña E and Juan-Babot O and Mendieta G and Crespo J and Badimon L}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={175}, number={3}, pages={528-38}}
